page.title: 02CHELMARSH CHURCH
page.content: The church of St.Peter is an ancient building of stone,consisting of nave,porch and an embattled western tower with pinnacles containing a clock and 6 bells. In 1888 the church was restored,the roof repaired,the nave reseated in oak,a new organ erected and the screen restored.The stained windows are very attractive but at this time much repair work needs to be done to stop any further deteriation in the surrounding stone.In July,1985 over Â£6000 had been raised by local people but at least another Â£24000 is needed. The clock is of a very interesting design and is said to be the only one of its kind in the county.
